review:
Very much satisfied with this purchase. Purchased on Dussera festival and using it since last 3 weeks. My rating 4.5/5....

Picture Quality: Excellent for 4K and HD videos.
Not at all great for SD channels. You have to have HD set top box to enjoy picture quality. Other than SET TOP box, Netflix, Hotstar, YouTube(1080p and above resolutions) looks awesome on this TV.

Cons: There is automatic upgrade of picture quality for SD channels or Any online videos less than 720p....I feel that VU is good in that case.
Sometimes I feel that 60Hz motion rate is less and can see lags in picture....but this is intermittent and not for all videos.

Sound Quality:
4.5/5 for sound quality....I have 5 in 1 Sound System, but sound quality of this TV is so good that I just don't feel to connect it.

Smart? Definitely smart TV with all required apps on TV. You can also download any app from Goigle Play Store. Internet and Bluetooth connectivity is very good.
Air Mouse works flawlessly....I was little worried about its functionality before purchasing, but my 7 year old son too can browse or type easily with this remote air mouse.
Chromecast is inbuilt and works seamlessly.

I don't know how long it will go, but so far it is looking great. Even if this TV works great for next 5-7 years it is value fo money. Instead of spending 1lacs + for branded (Sony, Samsung) TV, this is far better deal. Choice is yours anyways.

Note: If you are looking for review on anything specific thing, let me know in reply and I can update it for you.

pros:

Best TV buying decision ever. Feeling lucky to have miss the MI TV flash sales. Coming to the TV

PROS
TV looks stunning in Silver Metal finish.
4K & HDR content is amazing to watch, 720p and 1080p is good if viewed from certain distance (>10ft), kindly avoid SD content.
Viewing angles are great (VA panel), Backlight dimming and Black levels are superb, considering the price.
4K in YouTube (Slight here and there framedrops in 2160p 60fps quality) and HDR in Netflix is a delight to watch.
HDR10 mode run flawlessly in Windows 10.
Audio quality is great on Music preset mode and wall mounted position.
Reads almost every File type from USB and HDD without a hitch. (120Mbps tested)
Audio only mode for music listening is a delight for me.
10 GB internal storage available for APP installation and storage
APK can be sideloaded without any problem (Just use sideload launcher to see the apps in Home screen)
Official Android, Google Chromecast(mirroring) and Assistant(needs work) support are an added benefit.
No serious audio lag on Bluetooth. (With my Logitech adapter)
I haven't tested heavy games, but installed Beach buggy and it runs smoothly, am sure others games too.
Power consumption <100W (Backlight Level@64), and audio only mode <30W.
Compatibility with keyboard and mouse (Tested), Gamepad (Not tested)
Free wall mounting.

CONS
Voice recognition is still fuzzy through smart remote.
4k Upscaling is mediocre even from high quality 1080p content.
DTH HD channels are OK to watch.
Amazon prime is not supporting natively.
Back side ports are tough to reach after wall mounting.(ofcourse expected)
Android TV playstore has limited app support. (Not a TV con though)
Dolby TRUEHD audio codecs are not fully supported.

Other thoughts
Should add delayed confirmation upon power off switch through remote.
Safely remove storage shortcut will be a nice option to add.
OTA for android and remote voice search is expected soon.
Auto power OFF option (<1hr preferred) would be great to have.
Flash sales are tricky (COD option has better chances)
3 USB ports and Panel reflection should improved slightly on next model.

Thanks FLIPKART for providing and Jeeves for installing this awesome TV for me.
Highly RECOMMENDED for everyone out there with a 50K budget looking for a 55" 4K HDR TV experience.

I have bought this TV during Independence Day flash sales, after repeated failed attempts in the past. It has been two weeks since I am using this product and will share my experiences so that you can have better idea about the product before any investment. The TV set was delivered on time but it took 1 week time to get it installed by the technician, hence my first hand experience was very bad with the flipkart technicians. Moving onwards after installation the TV work exceptionally well, the major USPs are its picture quality and off course sound, sound is sufficient enough that you don't need any extra speakers with the TV set. If you are buying a Smart TV then the net connectivity becomes an important parameter and trust me this TV has exceptional connectivity. I am not using any set box, I simply use my mobile handset's hotspot for Internet access and I enjoys all the online contents of YouTube, Netflix and other apps seamlessly. For 4K videos you must have better Internet connectivity (I 've already registered for Jio Fibre plan, after getting same I'll be able to enjoy 4K conte ts as well.). This is a must buy product which has unique features as: 1. Highly Competitive Price Range 2. Google certified android (Which not there in its competitors, especially Mi TV) 3. Better Specification than Mi TV 4. Excellant picture quality 5. Crisp clear sound feature which dies not requires additional speakers 6. Tge build and design is sturdy yet very slim. Like every products it has some cons too like 1. Installation service was below satisfactory, I can't generalise this thing but it was my experience. Rest all are excellent, I feel like rate it as 4 star just because of its post sales services but the more features of this TV compelled me to give 5 star. I hope this would be helpful for you.

tv works good. fully android tv. user interface is good. i purchased MI TV 4 on first sale in feb and now i purchased IFFALCIN TV. campared to both we can say MI TV 4 is not at all android it runs on patchwall os , before purchasing i imagined lot about mi tv 4. but after my 4 months experience mi tv is not good for people who want to be tech edicted. when we came to IFFALCON its completely android certified. can install directly apps from good play store and no need to use third party installation apps. yes its 4k is really good. and more over its google voice assistant is awesome reduces typing time. i sugges you to go with extended warrenty offered by flipkart partner jeevas.

I should probably tell you that I am also one of those disgruntled members of the mi tv4 club. Its samsung panel was very tempting, though i later realized (thankfully) that it was bottom lit with no local dimming. The obvious other choice was Vu. It had full array backlight and its contrast and colors were well reviewed. Then came this beast, with its perfect spec sheet of android, air mouse and micro-dimming. Immediately, missing out on the mi seemed a blessing in disguise.

About the Tv now... its well-built with a solid frame and a panel that doesn't seem to be much reflective. Full points there. The design though, is not something that impresses.
Switching on takes some time and since i had my DTH connected, it went straight to it. SD channels look OK for a 55' tv. HD channels look very good with ample sharpness and upscaling. Color reproduction is my only concern as it is nowhere near my 32' Lg 3d tv that is 6 years old. Even when set for "cold" temp setting, the colors appear warm, especially the whites. That said, local dimming and motion rates are good.

DTH apart, moving on to web content (downloaded movies and videos, both 10bit 1080p and 4k HDR10 content).
Settings: color 70, contrast 70, sharpness 70, brightness 60.
Starting with The Grand Tour and Logan in 10bit 1080p, even when played in 16:9 full screen, the sharpness was excellent (could see every hair in Logan's beard), colors really good and nice contrast. Moving on to 4k..videos in YouTube do not seem to support HDR, but the sample videos from samsung and lg looked just awesome with punchy colors and responsive local dimming for a great contrast. But it is in 4k HDR videos is where i got truly blown off. Tried the Blade Runner (4k HDR BT2020 DTS, atmos) and it played without breaking a sweat. Oh the colors!..i dont have the words to describe them, having used excellent and awesome already :P...the details in the sky, gold colored walls, lit areas in dark backgrounds all seemed truly HDR.

Sound: In spite of ppl saying that the sound is not that good, i find that the surround sound aspect of the speakers is really good. While watching IPL and Football, the stadium effect was... real. Volume is quite loud and there is a hint of bass. It really gives a big speaker kind of effect, especially in voice sequences, which can take some time to get used to. Dolby atmos seems to work or was it DTS track that was rendered in the Blade Runner movie I am not sure, but the quality was awesome.

Haven't tried out the Android part of the Tv much. The UI is OK and quiet easy to use. For accessing USB, had to go to settings which is irritating.

Both the remotes are suspiciously heavy, ooze quality and work well (air mouse too).

To realize the full potential of the Tv, watch it from a good distance, preferably > 10 feet.

The product was beyond expectations ...
1) YouTube videos - 4k
2) Hotstar - 4k and awesome contrast
3) DTS is mind blowing
4)USB- fast rendering and UHD
5)Google certified is seemingly comfortable
6) Good adaptation to colors
7)DTH HD clarity is ok compared to Hotstar videos and YouTube
8) Dolby support is awesome with Hometheatre.
overall worth 5 rating and is far beyond Mi TV (according to reviews)
9) Renders 61gb size Imax HDR10 without any lag even i7 8gb laptop fails to play smoothly

One of the best purchase in flipkart by me..It truely deserves 5/5 for every penny i have paid. I brought this in first sale only on 7th may 2018..delivered on 11th may, Demo and installation done on 12th may by jeeves. I have done tabletop installation. Wallmounting i can do anytime with jeevesas i want which is due, a good feature. As it is VA panel with 10 bit HDR , the pictures in this looks vibrant and gorgeous. Just download a hdr 10 bit video sample from 4kmedia.org and see it by yourself , its far far better than a non hdr simple 4k videos...love it. Full hd channel 1080i by dish tv had very good display in this tv. Sd channel are not good once you have seen the hdr videos. Black looks almost perfect black as a result whites and brighter contents looks excellent and evolving. No led bleeding observed, though it is edgelit . As it is va pan viewing angles are not that great ,brightness shift seen beyoud 90* degrees its major con but who sees such tv at mor than this angle.But in one line brightness and vividness is awesome . Audio is awesome with dolby and dts speaker .Its loud and clear with some bass effect. I have rarely used volume beyond 50 range . I use sony HTIV 300 home theatre...oh boy its awesome.....and mindblowing..I use toslink cable brought from amazon...its crystal cear 5.1 audio from dth hd channel audio which has dolby support. The HDMI ARC is also working fine..but sometine on switching channels audio goes out may be fault of supplied cable by dth. But now it is not having such case.. Let me try new hdmi cable i orderd from amazon....connectivuty wise it has every port that too in sufficient and approachable ..... Suppled power cord attached to tv is ok okay type but 2 pin good quality. Look wise tv is also gool as like tcl tv signature with sturdy aluminium stand..Its metallic bezel is good looking .Its slim also...with good ventilation on back.Usb 3.0 is very good...also supporting 2 tb seagate hdd. Usually inbuilt palyer support almost all codec. As it is smart tv...with 7.0 google certified youu tube 720p onwards video are awesome. Mirror casring using t. ast applicatin is very nice...but initially it was not working..but now with minimal delay it was working very nice. Bluetooth teethering with home theatre is good. Good connectivity with internet via wify..no disconnection. But google pay store has no much apps...not even chrome...Its not good.Asphalt 8 was very nice with no lag. Usb 2.0 is also working good. I had added jeeves extender warrrnty of 2 years after purchase for Rs. 3570 from its website as it was not showing while purcahse in first sale...Tension free 2 years extra after manufacturer warrenty......Overall a very good purchase for Rs 45999....Satisfied with both auio and video performance...Ideal viewing dustance is 10- 12 feet is. very good. Hope tcl will have good swrvice if anything goes wrong...hope it will be avery good purchase. Thanks flipkart and Omnitech retail.Thank you.

WARNING: This is going to be a long and detailed review, so please prepare yourselves.

Experience from Flipkart and Jeeves: (3.5/5)
I ordered the TV on 10th July and. received it on 15th July, was kind of disappointed because everyone in reviews claimed that they received it the next day of ordering, but anyways. It was installed on 16th July (the next day after delivery). Installation guy from jeeves was nice, and he installed it perfectly and very quickly(even installed a photo frame and a settop box stand on asking him for free).

Picture Quality: (5/5)
Picture quality is really really nice. The colours are very balanced and punchy, looks natural and pleasing, unlike some TV's which are too much oversaturated or dull. Sharpness is very balanced as well and even 720p content looks great.
4K content looks amazing, I played some 4K HDR demo videos amd they were crisp, a lot of details could be seen. I also played Blade Runner 2049 4K HDR movie (it was a whooping 75GB+) and it looked stunning. Dark scenes look amazing, blacks are very deep and we can see details in shadows and dark areas too. YouTube 4K looks great aswell and Netflix 4K also looks wonderful. Settop Box HD content looks beautiful as well (not as good as 4k, but if you watch it from a distance of 7-8 feet+, even settop box HD channels will look good. SD content on the other hand looks a little bad when you compare it with the HD and 4K, but it still looks watchable amd is not really a problem if you watch it from 8 feet+ distance. Compared to other TVs the SD content looks better on this due to the picture upscaling present on this. HDR10 is great as well.
Overall this TV's picture quality can be compared to any Samsung, Sony or LG 4K TV under 1.5 lakh.

Sound: (4.5/5)
It has got 2 speakers with total output of 16 watts which might not sound like a lot on paper, but in reality it is more than sufficient even for a medium sized hall. Speaker is very loud and delivers clear audio. It even has hints of bass in it, which makes the speakers sound really rich, and not tinny. With my settop box at maximum volume, on the TV a volume between 20-30 units is loud enough for casual viewing, though I will still not recommend using this TV without external speakers and a subwoofer if you watch movies. For regular TV series, sports and news, speakers are more than enough.

Android OS: (4/5)
Android TV on this price range is just incredible. The Android TV interface is smooth and fluid for most of the time except for sometimes when you press home button from some heavy apps, it takes a little time to respond. I installed apps like Terrarium TV, Freeflix HQ, KODI with addons, JioTV and JioCinema on it. All of them work like a charm. They will provode you a lot of content. Overall experience is good but apps in playstore are limited (due to less apps for Android TV) and it kind of lags when opening or closing apps. Chromecast also works like a charm, no lags no buffering and connects to the TV in a jiffy. Awesome experience with Chromecast. Screen mirroring works fine as well, though it's mot as smooth as Chromecast.

Smart Remote: (4/5)
Smart Remote is just lovely, works like a charm, is very responsive as well. Air mouse is very accurate amd responsive, buttons are click and tactile, provide you a lot of feedback. Microphone works as well, the only issue being that you have to speak a little loudly, otherwise it might not recognize what you're saying. Another problem is the button placement, the Netflix button is placed right below the back button, sometimes in dark I accidentally pressed the Netflix button instead of Back button which became very frustrating, but I guess it'll take some getting used to.

Design and Build Quality:(4.5/5)
Build Quality is excellent (much better than MiTV4 which is very fragile. It has a silver frame made out of brushed aluminium and not plastic which looks as well as feels great. Build Quality is noce and design looks great aswell. Table Stand and wall Mount are both of really nice quality.

It’s such a pleasure to be the first one to review & amongst the first ones to receive this TV. I booked yesterday & the delivery, installation, demo is already done by 1 pm today. Crazy service by Flipkart, hats off & thanks a lot to them.

4K content looks amazing, I played some 4K HDR demo videos amd they were crisp, a lot of details could be seen. I also played Blade Runner 2049 4K HDR movie (it was a whooping 75GB+) and it looked stunning. Dark scenes look amazing, blacks are very deep and we can see details in shadows and dark areas too. YouTube 4K looks great aswell and Netflix 4K also looks wonderful. Settop Box HD content looks beautiful as well (not as good as 4k, but if you watch it from a distance of 7-8 feet+, even settop box HD channels will look good. SD content on the other hand looks a little bad when you compare it with the HD and 4K, but it still looks watchable amd is not really a problem if you watch it from 8 feet+ distance. Compared to other TVs the SD content looks better on this due to the picture upscaling present on this. HDR10 is great as well.
Overall this TV's picture quality can be compared to any Samsung, Sony or LG 4K TV under 1.5 lakh.

Sound: (4.5/5)
It has got 2 speakers with total output of 16 watts which might not sound like a lot on paper, but in reality it is more than sufficient even for a medium sized hall. Speaker is very loud and delivers clear audio. It even has hints of bass in it, which makes the speakers sound really rich, and not tinny. With my settop box at maximum volume, on the TV a volume between 20-30 units is loud enough for casual viewing, though I will still not recommend using this TV without external speakers and a subwoofer if you watch movies. For regular TV series, sports and news, speakers are more than enough.

Android OS: (4/5)
Android TV on this price range is just incredible. The Android TV interface is smooth and fluid for most of the time except for sometimes when you press home button from some heavy apps, it takes a little time to respond. I installed apps like Terrarium TV, Freeflix HQ, KODI with addons, JioTV and JioCinema on it. All of them work like a charm. They will provode you a lot of content. Overall experience is good but apps in playstore are limited (due to less apps for Android TV) and it kind of lags when opening or closing apps. Chromecast also works like a charm, no lags no buffering and connects to the TV in a jiffy. Awesome experience with Chromecast. Screen mirroring works fine as well, though it's mot as smooth as Chromecast.

Smart Remote: (4/5)
Smart Remote is just lovely, works like a charm, is very responsive as well. Air mouse is very accurate amd responsive, buttons are click and tactile, provide you a lot of feedback. Microphone works as well, the only issue being that you have to speak a little loudly, otherwise it might not recognize what you're saying. Another problem is the button placement, the Netflix button is placed right below the back button, sometimes in dark I accidentally pressed the Netflix button instead of Back button which became very frustrating, but I guess it'll take some getting used to.

Design and Build Quality:(4.5/5)
Build Quality is excellent (much better than MiTV4 which is very fragile. It has a silver frame made out of brushed aluminium and not plastic which looks as well as feels great. Build Quality is noce and design looks great aswell. Table Stand and wall Mount are both of really nice quality.

Been using the product for 2 days now. There's a few issues I have with it.

1) There is no option to mirror your screen from the laptop. Even though screen mirroring is listed as a feature, I've gone through the manual and the TV but there seems to be no option for it. You can however use 3rd party apps to chromecast whatever video you're playing on your laptop so that's a positive.

2) The TV boot time is pretty high compared to some of the other smart TVs out there. Takes about 30 seconds to boot, due to various loading screens.

3) There's no auto brightness feature. It's advertised. But again, I don't see an option for it. I seriously don't understand why they advertise a feature but its not available.

4) The installation person didn't show up on the date of supposed installation so I did it myself. Wasn't too hard, so you should be able to do it yourself, should you ever require it.

The screen itself is pretty good! The display has a tendency to display pictures on the warmer side, so if you're used to a cooler colour temperature, I'd suggest you adjust it.

The sound quality is as expected. Gets quite loud. Nothing extraordinary.

HDR10 works fine too! If you have a Netflix account, you check out some of their shows such as Stranger Things, or Lost in Space which are both HDR compatible shows.

I've been using this TV for a few months now, and I've concluded that the slightly cheaper non-Android version of this same model would have been a better purchase. However, that model doesn't appear to be available anymore, and the price for this Android version seems to have dipped below what the non-Android version cost when I bought the TV. Here's my detailed evaluation:

Pros:

- True HDR10 that works with both Windows 10, and PS4. This panel has entry level HDR performance, with the peak brightness hovering somewhere between 400 and 500 nits - I checked this with calibration tools in many games, and standalone applications on Windows - a difference in brightness is noticeable to within that range.
- HDR image is (extremely) noticeably better than non-HDR images. I've played Horizon: Zero Dawn on the PS4, and Mass Effect Andromeda on the PC with HDR turned on, and the difference from the non-HDR image is nothing short of startling. In the title screen of Horizon: Zero Dawn, we're shown an image of a valley with the sun rising. With HDR turned on, the sun is "much" brighter than the rest of the image, but all the remaining areas remain correctly lit. With HDR turned off, the whole image feels "flat", with all portions of the image seemingly compressed in terms of the range of brightness being shown. The increase in image quailty is very difficult to describe, but IMHO, an HDR mastered image is unquestionably better than non-HDR.
- The HDR image quality difference in Netflix is much less obvious - possibly because of the extreme compression that Netflix content is subjected to anyway. It's still gorgeous.
- Uncompressed 4K HDR video content looks "amazing". Colours pop, and details are super-sharp. I've been using a much older TV / monitors for some time now, so this is a massive upgrade for me, even if this panel is entry-level.

Cons:

- Micro-dimming feature doesn't appear to work / makes image contrast worse. This panel is supposed to have a "full array" of LEDs for backlight, which should mean that when the feature is turned on, black / darker areas of the image should become darker, thereby increasing contrast - instead the OPPOSITE occurs. Whenever I've turned on micro-dimming, darker areas of the image all brighten! There seems to be some issue with the firmware / software that's controlling the feature - it seems to be doing the opposite of what it's supposed to. This is very disappointing because micro-dimming was one of the highlight features of this TV for me when I picked it over the Mi TV 4K (edge-lit). The feature also seems to introduce visual artifacts (shimmering), which was visible when I played Mass Effect: Andromeda. What's really disappointing is that it feels like this could be fixed with a software update, but I doubt that that's ever going to happen. Manufacturers rarely give software updates for such appliances - features either work out of the box, or they don't.
- Terribly long boot-up time, and stand-by feature that's supposed to bring the TV back from a low-power state doesn't work consistently. I also experienced some weird image artifacts when playing Mass Effect Andromeda on PC with HDR10 (shimmering). I leave this feature turned off all the time now.
- Rather boxy appearance - current generation of televisions have much slimmer bezels. These aren't bad looking - it's just that current gen (Mi TV, for example) look much better.

Its exceptional. After 2 weeks of TV hunting and 3 unsuccessful MI TV flash sales, I finally decided to buy this and Boy, it did fulfilled my expectations with ample measures. Like everyone else, I too am thankful that I could not buy Mi TV whose online flash sale is a gimmick as its available on Mi offline stores. When I visited MI store I was not at all impressed with picture quality. SD channels viewing experience was a deal breaker. Black levels were real bad.Sound quality was also average. With that hands on experience I decided not to go with Mi. LG, SONY and SAMSUNG were out of budget. I was also keeping an eye on this as good reviews were pouring in and I was getting confident about it. Then on 12th June sale, I tried to add it to my card casually and it did actually get added. Coming from an MI flash sale experience it was kind of surprise for me and next I found myself punching OTP on payment page LOL. What I mean to say here that ,I did not do enough of research. TV was delivered on 14th June and installation was done on 16th June. Jeeves' person did a good job of getting it installed on 3 days before scheduled date. Thanks to Flipkart for hassle free buying experience. Now coming to Pros and cons.
Pros:
1. Excellent picture quality. Believe me guys 4k videos are treat to watch. Black levels are really good which enhance the overall viewing experience. HD channels are also playing very good, however it also depends on quality of HD content. I found SD channels playing decent. Its not bad for sure. I have seen reputed brands like Sony and LG and I found they were also not great when it comes to play SD channels. Although I could only review few of their stocks which were under Rs 90k. In this segment it beats Mi hands down.

2. Good sound quality. I have a 12 feet by 20 feet living room and sound level at 30 is more than enough.

3. Good android experience. Games are running smooth and I did not experience any lag whatsoever. Playstore does not have many aps. I was disappointed not to find Prime Video app in there. Yet to try sideloading.

4. Air mouse is convenient. The built of the smaller remote is very good. It comes with two remotes. Did I tell you they packed 2 set of batteries?

5. Aluminum frame looks premium.

Cons: I could spot few

1. While watching games like cricket/footballs on Hotstar I found some amount of frame lagging i.e. fast moving videos were not smooth. I am yet to try it on DTH. This could have been better. I need to find out whether this can be fixed with settings.

2. Sound cannot be customized greatly. There are preset sound settings but even after playing with them, I did not find much change in sound quality. Even personal mode does not alter sound. Need to research more on it.

3. TV channels cannot be changed with TV remote.

Thats it. For a price of Rs 46k, its a steal. If only it proves to be long lasting, I am sure it will give big brands run for their money. TCL and iFfalcon should think of offering extended warranty for this model. Dont think twice, it surely will fulfill all your expectations with this budget range and even higher. Go for it.

verdict : iFFALCON 55 is way way better than mi 55.

picture - This is where iFFALCON is miles ahead of mi. iFFALCON is DLED which means it has LEDs uniformly spread on back of TV whereas mi is edge led which means it has LEDs only on edges. Also, iFFALCON has micro dimming which means blacks are way way better.

connectivity - both are equal

service - both are equal

build quality - again, iFFALCON is way better.

overall, could not understand why people are falling for hype of mi, when a genuinely good product is available in market.

Make a informed decision, India! All the best !

It is best buy today. I have bought Mi tv and VU tv also earlier but when I bought this one and used it for 2 months, Now I can say this is the best buy for smart TV. TCL is world 3rd largest co and quality of this TV is outstanding. IT is a branded tv.. don't think that it is cheap or unbranded. So my advise is to buy this..

The TV is manufactured by TCL in China. The display of the TV is fantastic. It is a proper 10 bit display with support for HDR10 as well as HLG. Speakers are just okay. I highly recommend using external speakers with the TV for better sound experience.

However there are some issues:

First - The chipset of the TV is slow. Navigation through the Android interface is not fast. The inbuilt decoder is just enough for playing 4K HDR 60FPS videos. It does not have any processing headroom left when playing such videos. 4K HDR 60FPS videos run smoothly only on the built in media player. If you try to play them on any other player downloaded from the app store, the videos stutter badly.

Second - The volume output of the optical audio out cannot be controlled. The TV sends out audio at full volume no matter the volume level of the TV. If your home theater system/optical audio decoder has input volume adjustment, then it is fine. However if you don't have adjustment on the audio receiver system, then there is a problem. Because the audio is sent at full volume, there is a lot of disturbance in the audio. Hence this causes the users to have an incomplete experience and leaves them wanting this basic facility in the TV. Because of this flaw, I cannot play videos directly on the TV. I have to play them on some device to which the TV is connected via HDMI and adjust the volume on the playback device. I had to spend 5.5K rupees on purchasing an android box for the TV because of this flaw.

Third - There are bugs in the TV motherboard. Many times the TV restarts while being used. Sometimes is restarts 3-4 times a day. It can get very annoying.

Fourth - This is a minor flaw. The TV does not have analogue 5.1 channel output. Hence you need to purchase a decoder if your sound system does not support optical audio input.

Based on my experience I have one recommendation for the buyers: take your time to go through the different settings of the TV. It offers separate video adjustments for SDR, HDR, and HLG videos. Download demo videos of each type and play them directly on the TV through USB storage device and make adjustments for all the profiles of all the video types. Particularly adjust the brightness, as the TV has very high brightness set as default value and you don't need that much brightness. I never need more than 15%, even during daytime. Reducing the brightness will reduce the power consumption and increase the life of the TV components.

The price of the TV is very good. If you can live with the issues, then it is a very good display at this price.

A Good TV! Quick delivery, quick installation. Happy with the performance so far. This is my second UHD TV, the first one was 49 inch ( top manufacturer) bought for 1.6L four years back. Hope the maintenance of TCL also will be at par with the other TV.

Just keep you informed about the cons:
1. The boot time of the TV is exactly 1min, but my other UHD TV takes only about 5sec.
2. Could not find a menu item to increase the brightness( I am yet to explore all options in this TV)
3. Bug: When you connect Bluetooth device there is a sound lag of some micro sec. When you switch from Bluetooth to normal TV, the sound lag continues. If you switch between sources and come back to DTH then that get corrected.
4. Timelag, PVR, EPG options are not there in this TV ( think because we are always on DTH), though its mentioned in the operational manual.

Pros
1. Excellent Build Quality and Looks Premium
2. Great Audio quality.
3. HDR 10 panel
4. Android certified
5. Bluetooth Remote along with Normal IR remote
6. Easy to access HDMI, USB and Aux ports even if wall mounted
7. Inbuilt Chromecast
8. Micro dimming which enhances picture quality
9. Air Mouse is excellent for easier use of tv
10. Value for money. got for 31k after exchanging CRT tv
11. Free wall mount included (500rs charged for other TVs)

Cons
1. Slow bootup time because of Android Tv ( takes an average of 60-90secs to boot)
2. Content below 1080p will look really bad because it is a 4k Tv
3. Chrome not available on play store. (Can be sideloaded)
4. No user manual provided with the TV
5. TV will be automatically turned off in 60secs after a warning popping up. Not sure how it works. Mostly it pops up at late night. it's a auto stand by mode. still haven't find a solution to turn it off.

Other then this TV is must by at this price range.
Rating 9/10

I saw many reviews here about some bad experience with this TV. Hence after my purchase I waited for 1 month to post a review and my experience has been really great with this TV.

My actual use of this TV is for PS4 pro gaming and YouTube Hotstar. Both experience has been great a value of money product.

The only issue I faced is with Voice command that is getting Hanged when I try to use. It did work before and recently I faced this issue. I assume it needs an update and should fix this issue.

Rest the overall experience has been great with this TV.

My review after 2 weeks, the picture quality is excellent only on full HD and above, so you should have the one if you want to enjoy the features. I am using external sound bar using HDMI ARC and the sound quality is good with required bass. I got it for around 19k after my old 32 Samsung led exchange, so I believe it's a good deal for me. So overall it's worth at this price where as other brands are higher with similar features.

Everything from picture quality to sound to connectivity is good. My blaupunkt sound system does not get recognized via HDMI ARC or Bluetooth. I think it's issue with the sound system, as I'm able to connect other headphones using Bluetooth. I connected sound system using optical out and is good. One major cons: SD video up scaling is not upto the mark. Side loaded prime video. It works but picture quality on prime is not as good as you tube. It may be prime video streaming issue. If you get it less than 30K it's a good deal.

I dont use android part of TV so I dont have any idea how it fares in that domain, but from HDMI input perspective and from a current laptop this TV shines. Lots of customization and minimal LED bleed. We can tweak and get enough saturation for a good casual Multimedia Experience. Audio is good via Digital Optical Output plus it sounded powerful via headphones output too. Metallic Bezels are cool and can match those steel vintage Sony/Philips Amps and Players. I cannot ask for more from this TV. In fact the seller had scheduled an installation personnel too but we all know they lack the necessary IQ to set modern TVs. If this is what a cheap average TV has to offer I am interested in seeing what is held by those high end TVs.

Last but not the least- the courier fellows opened the set and gave liberty to turn it on and check before they left. This saves a lot of trouble in case some manufacturing or transportation defect occurs.

Thanks TCL, Flipkart and Courier services. Keep up the good job.

This was my first 4k tv so was a bit sceptical over going for a lesser known brand. Big brands cost too much and with the technology changing at such a rapid rate, investing so much money on a big brand tv didn't seem worth to me. My Thoughts: (After 15 days of installation and usage)
* Everybody said - think about buying smthng so expensive as this company (TCL) is not much heard in India; go for MI
* I took the risk looking at the comparison in tech specs for MI 4k & TCL 4K. I'm happy, i paid it gladly
* This is by far the best purchase I made on Flipkart (after My MacBook Air of course)
* Yet to experience gaming though

Pro:
* Elegant look ; Performance is good
* Picture and Audio Quality is great
* Price is definitely the best for a 55 inch 4K Smart TV range
* Easy to pair Bluetooth devices (specially headphones)
* Best part is mirroring mobile device, is so good
* Installation and demo was really good. 1 Star for Jeeves technicians

Cons:
* Don't update all the apps at once or none will get updated. Update one app at a time
* Takes 2-3 click on the remote to switch on the TV
* e-Manual is basic; Need more information regarding settings and TV setup
* Google Speech recognition using TV remote requires some serious update. Work like charm sometimes only
* Need some kind of app to use Mac laptops wirelessly, as I have to use HDMI cable and converters. Its pretty inconvenient.

Overall 5 star coz it was worth it. Thanks to Flipkart, TCL & Jeeves.

Do not hesitate to buy this new brand iFFalcon from TCL. Being a tech blogger, I have a habit of experimenting and I did go with this brand as the picture quality as far better if we compare it with MI or other competitors. Though the bezels don't look rich in look, but the picture quality is just good. Using air remote is just fun with voice search feature. I would say the Android TV has to go a long way, as it the normal exploring works lag free at the start, but it lags after a while. Still the experience was good. I tried casting my phone, used different apps like youtube, netflix & hotstar which can be downloaded through its own app store or play store. Played Asphalt game on the TV, used my smartphone as Android Remote. Overall experience was great and playing 4K videos was a great experience too.

The most amazing of all was the service from Flipkart Delivery and Jeeves(Flipkart's Service tie-up company). I got the TV delivered in 2 days and it was installed the same day in the evening. The quick installation was a shocker as I didn't expect this kind of good service. As flipkart has tied up with 3rd party company for service and installation, I was very confused if I should go with this brand or not. But it turned out to be a great decision.

The only 2 cons that I found were:
1. Bezels/design could have been a bit better.
2. The Android TV UI using experience could be more lag free!

Apart from that its a best buy!

Before I write further, let me caption one line for this.
"JUST BUY IT, DO NOT WASTE TIME WATCHING REVIEWS OF OTHER TV'S ON YOUTUBE"
Well, my search for a perfect 55 inch smart tv ended here when I found this TV.
I wouldn't say value for money, It is more than value, because you get way more than what you pay for.
For a price bracket under 50000 Rs, this is the best buy.
The sound quality is just amazing, I still haven't tried full volume but even half of the full volume will make you go crazy with its dolby DTS surround sound.
The picture quality is amazing. Watching netflix is such a joy.
The smart remote is way beyond the other smart remotes of the time. You can type and navigate with ease with the smart remote.
Youtube , Hotstar play very well.
There is so much you can do on this smart tv.
It will take me some time to explore all the features on this tv.
The design of the TV is eye catching, it will add more glamour to your living room or bedroom.
The make of it is very sturdy, unlike MI TV which is very fragile.
You can connect bluetooth home theatre system, blue tooth headphones, wireless mouse and keyboard. You need not to unpair one bluetooth device to pair the other.
Screen Cast works flawlessly.
There are ample of usb and hdmi ports to cater to all your needs.
The tv is smart enough to learn and show up what content you watch more and which apps and channels you tune into more and shows up the same on the streaming menu for your ease of access.
THERE IS ALOT MORE TO WRITE. AT LAST I WOULD JUST SAY DO NOT GO FOR ANY OTHER. JUST BUY THIS ONE , YOU WON'T REGRET.
THANKS.
JAI HIND.

I am writing this review after using the product for 2weeks. I bought this at no cost Emi (awesome buy for me of the year). I am using this one as internet tv with no dth connection. (only through Apps). I have bought the same after reading all reviews and videos comparing other models and brands within the price range and beyond. (Sorry but no comparison with O-led TVs.)
Pros:
Picture quality too good, provided you have a good speed in your internet plan. one can enjoy the best quality watching 4k and ultra HD videos.
Easy to connect: The product is easy to connect even with all other smart devices specially Alexa and Google home speakers.
Sound : Sound is okay and you can adjust the TV's internal speakers through both the remotes. It should be perfect for mid sized drawing, but one may require good quality speakers for hallrooms.
The package comes with 2 remotes but I bet you will start loving the smart remote with comes with voice command as well.
Delivery and Installation: Both delivery and installation were quick and the installation guy was quiet patient enough to show me all features and guided me to install apps.

Cons: As the TV comes with basic android.tv framework, there needs to be a lot of work done. Specially there are many streaming app which you won't find available in the Android TV play store. (though one can use the side-load these apps by downloading the Apps' Apk files in pendrive and install them as and when required, still as these apps have to side loaded there are some issues for some apps as they can't be updated) I faced this issue with apps like Jio Tv and Addatimes and Hoichoi. I hope these apps creators work on Android TV compatible versions soon.
Netflix doesn't come pre-installed and one has to side-load it, but it works perfectly fine. (for side-load please check YouTube videos available)

Firstly I would like to say it's value for Money,

well coming to this TV part,

I i purchased reading reviews about budget 4k tv below 50k rs and this seemed fit, Now coming to performance picture-looks good 4k,1080, even 720 seems decent,sd looks okayish. Distance of viewing will also effect your perception(read guides over Internet to know least distance for size of tv). Although the brightness seems low at times it would have been excellent if it was higher and & there was some sort of motion blur in some scenes while watching some scenes in some scenes only will try to upload the video (not sure about if its called motion blur or what). In some colours you can see that it is brighter at edges and there is some areas less brighter also at edges this might be because its edge lit. sound - surprising good for 16 watt speakers, loud, crisp and clear. Connectivity-good overall, but bluetooth headset stays connected you have to unpair them to disconnect, usb 3 port is provided so thats good for connecting hdd. Apps-not even browser is preloaded, have to side load mozilla, chrome etc.youtube looks good video loads fast. Side loaded apps doesn't show up on homepage.tv feels slow at times (button pressing and reaction delay is there) misc-tv takes more time to turn on than expected, Airmouse remote is good but its bottom edges keeps annoying me when constant holding the remote. Installation was done on next day of delivery. All in all satisfied with the purchase considering the cost, i guess people who demand higher brightness can seek other alternatives. No con is that great to skip this tv from price viewpoint (except brightness, uneven brightness and motion blur thing).

I was a bit sceptical when buying this TV because of some negative reviews online, but trusted my gut and thought of taking a chance by buying the extended warranty with it. Got it delivered in 2 days time and got the installation done the same day by Jeeves. Have to say I had a really good experience with the delivery and the installation. The installation guy was prompt on arranging a time and had set up the TV along with setting up the TV and doing all the explainations on the working of the TV. He promptly gave a demo of the TV and helped me checked the whole panel for any defects. So for service and delivery 5/5

TV picture quality -
Have to say it has got an amazing picture quality, I only use digital contents and all of them looked amazing, don't know about SD channels as haven't tried those yet. You can really make out the difference with HDR contents so again 5/5 on display.

Sound -
Built in speakers are pretty satisfactory for a budget TV. I am using a home theatre with digital out and that's working perfectly fine and giving a better sound quality than compared to my old Panasonic TV.

Software -
The software at first was running butter smooth but after playing around a bit and downloading a few softwares it became quite slow. So I had to restart the TV after which it became fine. Just a TIP if the software becomes laggy then keep the home button pressed and exit the apps that you aren't using like you do in phones and viola the software stops becoming laggy, so its all good on that end too :)

Verdict -
I have just been playing with the TV for a day and so far it checks all the box especially for the price that I got it for. Fingers crossed it should continue to function the same for the coming years. I personally think you should buy this TV in a heart beat can't get a better value for money than this.

This TV is real value for money.

- Picture quality is mind blowing at this price.
- 4K, Full HD videos look amazing.
- SD videos look shitty though. It is expected as the TV is Giant 55 inch 4K and converts SD videos to 4k resolution. Nahh!! ofcourse it will look bad.
- It offers good viewing angle.
- Sound quality is pretty good. It can get quiet loud so I didn't feel the necessity of an external speaker.
- Using Tata Sky and the HD channels are OK.
- It is android certified and you will be able to download most of the common android apps.
- Amazon Prime can be sideloaded and works like charm.
- HDR is supported and Netflix HDR 10 videos are stunning.
- The Bluetooth remote with air mouse and voice recognition functionality serves it purpose.

- The software is kind of buggy and I have already factory reset the TV once. After reset, Its working fine till now.
- The interface is sluggish sometimes.
- Motion blur is quiet evident if you are close to the TV. If you are at 8 to 10 foot distance, you won't recognise the blur.

The installation and demo support was horrible. The person who came for installation din't even know a thing about the TV and he dint wall mount the TV properly. Jeeves support, grow up and don't take installation service for granted. Flipkart, BEWARE!! your reputation is being spoiled bcoz of Jeeves. Afterall, any service in Bangalore is horrible. The service mentality is lacking here.

Final verdict-

This TV with all the features (4K, HDR, 16 GB ROM, 2.5 GB RAM, Official Android etc,) it brings to the table is real value for money. Afterall, the technology inside matters and not the brand. A person who understands technology will not blindly go behind any brands (ofcourse I am talking about Samsung, Sony etc.). cheers!

FYI, I got this TV for 32000 after exchange and discount. steal deal!

Honest review after 15 days usage.

Picture: for any one buying a 55k uhd tv, picture is the first parameter. Full he videos are nice to watch with appreciable upscaling to 4k. But 720p videos do look a bit odd..anything below 720p is not good. So always have a good internet connection and HD settop box for visual treats. 4k videos are mind blowing and a feast to watch.

Connectivity: All ports work excellently. No issues.

Bluetooth: I connected my 2.1 audio, bt headphoneas. all working perfectly. no disconnections between.

Remote: I liked the big remote...but air mouse remote is passable. Moreover u can control tv with ur mobile once connected to same wifi using Android TV app.

Sound: It is decent, vocals are very clear, some bass can be felt..overall better than expected

CONS:
Still running Android Nougat (7)
No promise about update
Google play store doesn't have many supported apps.
Netflix, YouTube work like charm but NO AMAZON PRIME APP OFFICIALLY.
I side loaded Amazon prime app but it often crashes and tv reboots itself sending us into misery.

Overall a great package for 36k...can't expect better.

Iffalcon by tcl is a great tv with great clarity. Bright and sharp colours and pictures. There is no difference between the display and sound of it and LG UHD smart TV which i also have. However there are 2 points I would like TCL to correct in their next series. Firstly the TV takes more than a minute (about 1 minute 42 sec) to bootup and start. Secondly TCL should come up with magic remote as the normal remote does not have the capability to be used alongwith the set top box, and also the android application remote is not at all reliable.
I would recommend to go for this TV as it is value for money. I m sure it is better than mi tv and cheaper too.

Value for money. As of 2018 no other 55 inch TV in the price bracket of Rs.46k provides an Android based system with in-built Netflix and Youtube. The applications glide smooth and fast as in Android phones.

Built quality of TV is sturdy. Picture is good with HD channels. Various preset picture modes are helpful and for those who wish to customise and explore, options do exist. Sharpness of picture may not be as good as that in a high end product but is acceotable. Unless one expects 5.1 channel quality sound, which is also rare in any other TV, it is acceptable. It connects seamlessly through HDMI Arc with 5.1 channel sound system.

The remotes are of satisfactory built quality and works well. The airmouse does it's job perfectly.

Within 7 days: I had issues with the hdmi ARC connectivity. Requested return. No response from Flipkart or TCL. Flipkart responded after the return period was about to expire and I had figured out the problem on my own. The issue still persists- hdmi arc port needs some fiddling to make it work. Port is loose.

Within 2 weeks: Whether TV switches "ON" is unpredictable.

Week 4: After groping with the Customer Care numbers, found a number which was working. Logged complaint and requested them to come on Saturday forenoon(as I would be available). They okayed the schedule.

04/08/2018(Saturday): Called to confirm on Friday evening and Engineer visit scheduled to 2.30 pm.

Called at 2.30 pm: Engineer visit re-scheduled for 90 minutes later. As I had postponed other engagements till 3.00 pm and could not wait any more, the servicing has been requested for 9/08 or 10/08/2018. Complaint logging is only over phone. No visual messaging system.

Will update review on the servicing if carried out satisfactorily.

Servicing: Engineer visit cancelled twice as the schedule was not convenient from both sides and Service provider could not provide slots after 6 pm.

Visited assessed the fault and replaced a board. For the hdmi ARC, the Technician advised for replacement of the cable and on replacement of this on my part, sound output is fine and TV is now in perfect condition.

The bottom line is that unless one has access to the free services, purchase may lead to heartburn. For the price paid it definitely is a value for money TV.

I had placed order for this TV with much anticipation, ultimately to get completely disappointed, with both Flipkart as well as the product. It seems everybody else is just happy with low price of big screen TV. I had complained about the problems in this TV, viz. Distorted sound on HD channels while using HDMI cable(screeching voices), no upscaling (in fact worse picture compared to FHD TV) of SD channels, Bluetooth remote not working properly, TV restarting while switching wifi connection and Chromecast working scratchy. Flipkart was fast to replace the first TV after technical evaluation. I received the second TV against pickup of first TV (that was great Flipkart). Got it installed on desktop and checked the above problems in front of installer cum demo guys. they again took the video of problems and I lodged complaint of REFUND with Flipkart on 5th Oct as now I am sure that these are inherent faults in the TV itself. On 7th, I received e mail from Flipkart that Return request CANNOT be fulfilled by the seller!! Now, who is the seller? its OmniTech Retail, ie Flipkart itself (sister concern, to be safe). They simply DIDN'T assign any reason for it. I certainly am going to raise this dispute further. If the product itself is FAULTY, how can Flipkart or seller or the Manufacturer deny REFUND???
Now positives, delivery was fast but installation was rescheduled several times. HD channels look good on big screen, price is very good, sound is also very good with tabletop mount. Its got Google Play!!! Screen is not reflective. If you got 4K content, it looks good on this TV.
And negatives - Don't have option to select USB in Input source selection, Wall-mount leaves no space behind TV to use HDMI and USB port situated at Back of the TV (side ones are accessible), same with Aux inputs.

Coming to the TV, there is noticeable bleeding across the top and bottom parallel to the top and bottom edges. Software and interface is very slow with log of lag. I doubt if it has 2.5 GB RAM. TV sometimes restarts by itself. HDMI ARC port of this TV does NOT work. Tried connecting the TV's HDMI ARC port with 2 different sound bars and 3 different cables. Doesn't work. Added to that, the Bluetooth of this TV doesn't work. It does not detect the soundbar. My 3 year phone connects to the soundbar by Bluetooth! This is definitely a regrettable purchases. I was attracted by the low price and the reviews. In hindsight, should have paid more for a more reputable brand like Samsung or LG.

***Update Oct 2020 - the motherboard has failed twice - after 7 month in Jan 2020 and again in Oct 2020. The black remote has stopped working as well. You get what you pay for. Lesson learned.

Warning on Flipkart extended warranty - it does NOT cover the remote. I paid for it thinking it was comprehensive and covered everything. Apparently it does not cover everything! TCL want Rs. 1800 for the black remote.

Overall TV is excellent but really disappointed (horrible) with service from Flipkart...no words to express my frustration after paying Rs. 42k

There has been multiple things that disappointed me about flipkart service and especially senior management and not junior folks not answering any queries. Senior management is not looking at contacting customer for any issues raised to them.

When I was planning to buy this tv it was giving 10% off for first time user and finally I was getting only Rs100 on Rs. 42k 😀. Really making fool of us by advt. of 10% off. I have been trying to get in touch with customer service and grievance officer Mr. Rajeev but no luck. Send multiple emails / calls but no response to it. That’s the service I got from them.

Today technician came and installed the TV but they were in lot of hurry. I don’t know why they have been given too many calls to be addressed on one day. They cannot make justice to their job. It is not technician fault but again their boss who is expecting from him to work like robot.

I hope correct message goes to senior folks of Flipkart .

Well installation was pretty staright forward....nothing complicated in it...Now from the previous reviews and other digital media reviews (including you tube)....it was evident that this TV is the best in BUDGET segment.... considering the features and picture quality...well THAT'S true...the TV has great picture quality....it's an Android TV...decent speaker....and THATS it....For me the TV is SLOW.....I mean the boot up time is close to 1 min....sure it can be corrected with instant ON feature....but then there is LAG...the response time from pressing the remote button to the TV responding to it is visibly slow...I mean you need to wait seconds...for the TV to response....then there is the Home screen...where when you move up or down the transition is jiggery.... sometimes there's is response delay so you again press the remote button thinking that TV didn't register the previous press of the button and now there is more delay...so basically the processor is slow....or the RAM is not sufficient...to handle the responses.....reminds me of my 1997 computer...with pentium 2 processor..! Net browsing is a pain on TV.... doesn't supports chrome...using maxthon browser....but it has bugs..very limited apps on Play store....tried to install other music apps like gaana but it's buggy...interface is very poor for the TV and there is LAG so much so that you just want to throw the remote.....other thing I noticed is that when instant on feature is on the apps starts to have hiccups particularly the gaming app...the race car freezes for seconds and again and again.... Thus for me this TV is only good for an average user who is into just watching TV, movies and you tube....other feature are there just for the Marketing business....For me the Android software on the TV has a poor implementation...and makes the TV buggy and painfully SLOW.

I am using this product for more than 2 months. My recommendation to all is to buy this TV without 2nd thought. this is the best in the market in this price range. But there are cons also.

after my extensive use, I found following problems:
1. Sudden crash & restart (mainly when you are opening side-loaded apps). suggest time to time close all background applications (by pressing home button for long time, all already opened apps will be visible in a row. remove all apps one by one except which you are currently watching) to keep memory clean.
2. User manual : a copy is available out of the box, but not much use. you need to explore yourself for most of the troubleshooting.
3. Audio output option. TV has 3 options. 1. 3.5 in audio jack (for headphone) 2. Bluetooth 3. SPDIF (Optical out). There is no Analog sound output port (A/V). HDMI port outputs (e;g, DTH, playstation) are ok though there is some delay between Video and Audio out. Bluetooth output to my Home theater (Sony) is a disaster. But for any videos from apps (e,g. Netflix ), via BlueTooth sound quality is very bad. Also there is huge delay. This need software update with immediate effect. But unfortunately there is no regular updates from Iffalcon, software product bug registration is not possible because TCL don't entertain Iffalcon TV related customer complains. But recently I used SPDIF (optical) port for output to my home theater. its superb. Changed my movie watching experience.
